definitions.definition: The act of surveying; a general view.
A particular view; an examination, especially an official examination, of a particular group of items, in order to ascertain the condition, quantity, or quality.
definitions.example: A survey of the stores of a ship; a survey of roads and bridges; a survey of buildings.

definitions.definition: The operation of finding the contour, dimensions, position, or other particulars of any part of the Earth's surface.
A measured plan and description of any portion of country.
definitions.example: The owners of the adjoining plots had conflicting surveys.

definitions.definition: An examination of the opinions of a group of people.
definitions.example: The local council conducted a survey of its residents to help it decide whether to go ahead with the roadside waste collection service.

definitions.definition: A questionnaire or similar instrument used for examining the opinions of a group of people.
definitions.example: I just filled out that survey on roadside waste pick-up.

definitions.definition: An auction at which a farm is let for three lives.
A district for the collection of customs under a particular officer.
To inspect, or take a view of; to view with attention, as from a high place; to overlook
definitions.example: He stood on a hill, and surveyed the surrounding country.

definitions.definition: To view with a scrutinizing eye; to examine.
To examine with reference to condition, situation, value, etc.; to examine and ascertain the state of
definitions.example: It was his job to survey buildings in order to determine their value and risks.

definitions.definition: To determine the form, extent, position, etc., of, as a tract of land, a coast, harbor, or the like, by means of linear and angular measurements, and the application of the principles of geometry and trigonometry
definitions.example: to survey land or a coast

definitions.definition: To examine and ascertain, as the boundaries and royalties of a manor, the tenure of the tenants, and the rent and value of the same.
To investigate the opinions, experiences, etc., of people by asking them questions; to conduct a survey; to administer a questionnaire.
